intro: Korthalsella vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific island of Vanuatu. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Korthalsella vitiensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited geographic distribution.
